title: 🔤 Consonant Quiz
description: Learn all 44 Thai consonants with pronunciation, meanings, and tone classes.

title: 🔤 Vowel Quiz
description: Practice 32 Thai vowels with sound patterns and example words.
proTip: Note: ก (goo gai) may appear as a placeholder to show vowel position; it is not part of the answer.

title: 🎨 Color Quiz
description: Practice Thai colors including light/dark modifiers with phonetics.

title: 🔢 Numbers Quiz
description: Practice Thai numbers with phonetics, from 0 to the millions.
proTip: Insert a classifier after the number when counting. e.g., 2 bottles = สองขวด (sɔ̌ɔŋ khùat), 5 people = ห้าคน (hâa khon).

title: ⏰ Time Quiz
description: Telling time in Thai: keywords, formats, and common phrases.
bullets: Key words (นาที, โมง, ทุ่ม, ครึ่ง, ตรง)
AM/PM patterns (ตี…, …โมงเช้า, …ทุ่ม)

title: ❓ Questions Quiz
description: Asking questions in Thai: core words and common patterns.
bullets: Question words (อะไร, ใคร, ที่ไหน, เมื่อไหร่, ทำไม)
Patterns (…ไหม, …ได้ไหม, เคย…ไหม)
proTip:
• Most yes/no questions end in “mái?”
• Add “khráp/khà” for politeness at the end
• Use “bâaŋ” after question words for ‘what kinds / which ones’

title: ⚡ Thai Tone Markers
description: Practice Thai tone outcomes by consonant class, tone mark, and vowel length.
bullets: Tone marks ( ่ ้ ๊ ๋ ) and none

title: 🚀 Common Action Verbs
description: Practice essential Thai action verbs with English, Thai, and phonetics.
proTip:
• Common combos: ‘tham ŋaan’ (work), ‘àap-náam’ (shower)
• Use ‘bpai/maa’ for go/come; add places with ‘thîi’ (at)

title: 🧑‍🧑‍🧒‍🧒 Thai Family Quiz
description: Learn Thai family members with Thai script and phonetics.

title: 📆 Months & Seasons
description: Practice Thai months and seasons with Thai script, phonetics, and examples.

title: 🔢 Common Thai Classifiers
description: Practice essential Thai classifiers with English, Thai, and phonetics.
proTip:
Structure: [noun] + [number] + [classifier]
‘nɯ̀ŋ’ (one) is often omitted in casual speech.

title: 🏠 Rooms Quiz
description: Learn Thai room and house vocabulary with phonetics and example sentences.
proTip:
• Use ‘hɔ̂ɔŋ’ (room) before specific room names
• ‘nai’ means ‘in’ — phǒm yùu nai hɔ̂ɔŋ nɔɔn (I’m in the bedroom)
• ‘thîi’ means ‘at’ — rao nâŋ lên thîi rá-biiang (We sit on the balcony)

title: 🕵🏻‍♂️👨‍💼 Thai Jobs Quiz
description: Practice Thai job and occupation vocabulary with phonetics.

title: ⏱️ Thai Tense Markers
description: Practice Thai time markers and aspects: now, already, not yet, soon, often, never.

title: 🍛 Common Thai Foods
description: Practice common Thai foods, fruits, and cooking methods with phonetics and examples.

title: 📅 Days of the Week
description: Thai days with phonetics, planet, and color associations.
proTip:
• ‘wan’ = day, used before every day name
• Each day links to a planet and traditional color in Thai culture
